Evaluation: Uncertainty Visualization

Have you ever used tractography in your patients?

Do you think that the use of tractography can potentially change clinical decision-making in your patients?

VISUALIZATION

Our simulation generates many possible variations of the same fiber tract (i.e., originated from the same ROI). The variations in the fiber tracts arises due to the underlying uncertainty sources present in the pipeline. A 3D view below shows an example case where the tumor is present in the left frontal lobe and nearby corticospinal tract. Selection can be made to visualize fiber tracts with and without uncertainty information. Sliders can be used to manipulate the anatomical slices.

No uncertainty
With uncertainty

https://faizansiddiqui91.github.io/Data/fibers.vtk https://faizansiddiqui91.github.io/Data/fiber_original.vtk https://faizansiddiqui91.github.io/Data/tumor.vtk https://faizansiddiqui91.github.io/Data/T1_mha_tumor.mha

So far we explain the visualization of the uncertainty in our system. We have generated some test cases and we would like you to answer the questions in relation to each case below.
